author: Ka
text:
UK Buyer Subjected to Import Charges When Buying from the UK

I recently purchased a handbag from a UK seller and purposefully did so as I reside in the UK to avoid import charges post Brexit.  When paying for the item, it clearly states £0 on Import Duties/Taxes which reassured me of this.  

Prior to this I've even read in the FAQ on the Vestiaire Collective website that nothing will change for UK buyers buying in the UK (even if it is not through direct shipping).

However, I received a email this morning from the courier stating I must pay £132.40 for import charges.  Baffled by this, I started spoke to a representative in their chatbox.  

At first, the representative told me they can go ahead and pay me back for the import charge once I paid it.  All I would need to do is provide proof it has been paid for.  A minute later he/she comes back to say, 'My bad and I apologize for the confusion.'  The representative goes on to say this refund is now not possible because I did not use the direct shipping method.  This does not make sense to me because again I why would I have to pay for import taxes on an item purchased from the same country?

Then, the representative goes on to tell me the £132.40 charge may be VAT which he/she says is different from inport charges but did not seem certain and will get back to me after he/she escalates this to a senior department.  I asked how I could follow up but the response is that I can only wait for them to contact me about this or email the support team (which I assume is would require me to explain the whole situation again to a new representative who may have to then escalate this issue to someone else.)

There is no clarity to this process.  I am very frustrated and cannot understand why I would be paying import taxes in this case.

*EDIT: I was reading some of the responses VC left for other comments left on Trust Pilot.  In one line it, they state 'When you buy in the UK from a UK seller, you won't be affected by VAT even if you select an authentication service.'--- SO WHY AM I BEING AFFECTED BY VAT?
title: UK Buyer Subjected to Import Charges…

author: Jayte
text:
VC is very much a mixed bag, with an apparent lack of consistency in various facets of customer operations.

I'll preface this by saying that I'm very particular about providing accurate descriptions and photographs, warts and all.
If an item has a flaw, no matter how minor, I will highlight and detail it.

Consequently, it is baffling and unprofessional when VC inexplicably amends an item description in either/or an inaccurate or illiterate manner.

If I correctly list an item as "Silk", for instance and VC mistakenly/randomly amends that to "Linen", I'd expect to have an unhappy and confused buyer in spite of the fact that I originally described the item correctly.

I'm therefore now checking every item carefully after it is listed and I'd recommend others do the same.

Trying to contact customer services in order to rectify the issue is typically more time consuming than listing the item in the first place! Further, a request to reinstate the originally description might not be honoured but rather replaced with a description that is butchered...again. 

Several times in the last few weeks, I've simply pulled items from VC due to the amount of time required to explain the issues to Customer Services, usually to little avail.

What is the purpose of staff amending detailed, *accurate* listings in a manner that can fundamentally change an item description and render it inaccurate? It makes no sense whatsoever and is a colossal waste of time for all involved!
title: Please stop the rogue edits/inserting incorrect details in listings
